Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that President Trump has ordered the military to take over "major corrupt cities" to stay in office. There is no evidence or basis for this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is promoted by known conspiracy theorists and has no basis in truth.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that a nationwide military takeover is imminent, without any evidence or credible sources.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that military and federal communications officials have rejected the claims and President Trump has signaled a peaceful transition to a new administration.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by stating that emergency alerts will be sent to U.S. citizens on their devices, which is not supported by any credible sources or official statements.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation to the claim is that it is a rumor or misinformation spread on social media platforms without any factual basis.
